snippet: A decision to dismantle tsunami sirens on the Oregon coast has some residents concerned that the new warning system — texts and phone calls — will not reach everyone.
abstract: Oregon coastal community of Tillamook County decides to dismantle its tsunamis sirens, saying $100,000 needed to upgrade 1960s-dated technology is not worth it; some residents fear new tools of warning, text messages and automated calls, could leave behind older residents and tourists who may not be reached by cellphone during an emergency.
lead_paragraph: A decision to dismantle tsunami sirens on the Oregon coast has some residents concerned that the new warning system — texts and phone calls — will not reach everyone.

headline.seo: New Ways to Warn Threaten Tsunami Sirens in Oregon
